notes:
### STATS

HP: +25 Health | Healing: 66 HPS

------
Basic opening build that prioritizes Mercy's HPS. 
### POWER

 [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) will be the foundation of this build. It's super fun to play with, synergizes well with powers we'll pick later on, *and* it's very strong on its own. So long as you're juggling your beam effectively, its basically a +50% increase to your healing & DMG boost output. It's also great for grabbing extra assists, which makes it very good for farming currency!

### ITEMS

 [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0)  +  [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf)  gives you a little extra healing, &  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6)  makes you a little tankier. 

 [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da)  can be an alternative to  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) , but I prefer  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) because of its straightforward DMG Mitigation. The armor basically gives you at least +7 extra effective HP.

### STATS

HP: +50 (+25 Armor, +25 Shields) | 
Healing: 83 HPS

------

On round 2, we get a big increase to our healing output, and try to secure +50 HP to stay safe.

### ITEMS

 [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e)  &  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) are priority items for this round, together they give a big boost to your healing. If you are too poor to afford both items, prioritize [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e), it gives more HPS than Firing Pin because its special effect (+10% AS) is always active for Caduceus Staff.

Adding  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da)  will make you tankier, but if you can't afford it, consider  [Running Shoes](item_950eccea-31a0-4a55-8c2a-75bf7920e1aa)  or  [Charged Plating](item_b8ca58e7-6ae2-40ee-8618-fe2f32315295)  instead. 

If you are rich (15,000+ Currency), consider building  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a)  instead of  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054). If you are *very* rich (17,750+ Currency), you can build both  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a)  &  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054) , replacing  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) instead. This will give you ~90 HPS.

round_upgrades.notes: Consider grabbing this if you need extra survivability, it's not listed here, but it gives you +25 HP. I also just like the overhealth effect, you can use it kind of like a burst heal, & it gives Valk a little extra oomph in these earlier rounds.
Build this if you need to be super tanky, it's probably the best rare survival item for Mercy. It's easy for her to stack the overhealth with GA.

notes:
### STATS

HP: +50 (+25 Armor, +25 Health) | 
Healing: 94-108 HPS

------
### POWERS

[Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb)  is probably Mercy's strongest power. It turns one of the worst ults in the game into one of the best, has great synergy with many of Mercy's other powers, *and* it's great for farming currency.  I think it's important to build on either round 1 or 2, so we're picking it up here.

Together with  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb), you build your ult faster, and your ult is much stronger. I consider these two powers irreplaceable for this build.

### ITEMS

For items, the example is a budget round 3 build that prioritizes HPS.  [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124)  gives a substantial increase to your HPS, and its +25 HP makes it an efficient choice for replacing one of your survival items. If you can afford it, I recommend replacing your greens with any of the blue optional items.

#### **Alternatively**, another build to consider when you have more money (25,750+ Currency):  [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca)  |  [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a)   |  [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e) |  [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054)  |  [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0)  |  [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf) 

This build gives similar HPS (~94 HPS), alongside higher damage boost, faster ult charge, & more armor. I usually prefer this build unless I am in a situation where I need to prioritize healing (ex., with a low-healing cosupport, or team just taking a ton of damage).

round_upgrades.notes: Consider replacing Armored Vest with this so you can get Valk faster.
Build this if you need to be super tanky, it's probably the best rare survival item for Mercy. It's easy for her to stack the overhealth with GA.

Consider grabbing this if you need extra survivability, it's not listed here, but it gives you +25 HP. I also just like the overhealth effect, you can use it kind of like a burst heal, & it gives Valk a little extra oomph in these earlier rounds.

notes:
### STATS

HP: +75 (+50 Armor, +25 Health) | 
Healing: 103-117 HPS | DMG Boost: 35% (+5%)

----

More HP and healing, not much else to say. 

### ITEMS

 [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124)  &  [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) are the essentials here, together they just give you so much extra healing, damage boost, & HP. There are a lot of other great items for Mercy, but I find it hard to pass these two up.

...except [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca), sometimes.  Situationally, I will find myself choosing [Blessed Boosters](item_957fd380-b7b4-40d4-8333-bb8c535ca931),  [Overdrive Core](item_a2a8dba1-5f2f-4da1-9445-b08f49162121), or [Caduceus Ex](item_9e7965ea-2abc-44a7-b042-950c6ad2fce7) for this round, instead. I have attached notes for which situations I like these items in. In later rounds, consider combining [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) alongside any of these items if you need a little extra survivability.

If you are still too poor to afford any of these items, look back to the round 3 build & upgrade whatever items you can.

round_upgrades.notes: Keep this if you build [Caduceus Ex] instead of [Chain Evoker]

Substitute with [Blessed Boosters] if the enemy team is chasing you around; [Overdrive Core] against Junkrats focusing you with tire;  [Caduceus Ex] if you need to healbot, or for pocketing Genjis & Tanks
This item can keep you alive through Junkrat's Riptire & Cassidy's High Noon, & can help you get off risky ress's. It's also nice just for the HP & +10% WP.
This item is so good for evading people focusing you, especially Genji & Kiriko. I really, really recommend this against them.

If you need to play a little safer, try this. The extra range lets you position so much more safely, & it's great for reaching Genji & Freya. Combine this with [Blessed Boosters] if you want to be untouchable.
Build this if you need to be super tanky, it's probably the best rare survival item for Mercy. It's easy for her to stack the overhealth with GA.

notes:
### STATS

HP: +75 (+50 Armor, +25 Health) | 
Healing: 115-130 HPS | DMG Boost: 35% (+5%)

----
Item choices become a lot more situational from here on out.

### POWERS
(***UPDATE*** [Glass Extra Full](item_659ff350-8602-42cd-b5f9-f4da7e5e912b) is currently bugged: Any amount of damage instantly deletes **all** 50 Overhealth. I.e., taking 1 damage gets rid of all of it. Until this is fixed, I would not recommend this power against beam characters like Zarya or Moira, who can instantly deplete the Overhealth from just 1 tick of their weapons.)

 [Glass Extra Full](item_659ff350-8602-42cd-b5f9-f4da7e5e912b)  is basically a free Epic Survival Item for all your teammates. It synergizes well with [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb) because both your beams can generate Overhealth, making it extra efficient. And with  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb), Valk now gives your teammates +50 HP for its duration. I think this power is best for helping squishy teammates stay alive against burst damage characters like Cassidy & torpedo spam Juno. After playing with it so often, my team feels so fragile when I don't pick it. You do have to yellowbeam more with this power, but its fine. More healing = faster ult = more DMG boost. 

**Alternative** Power choices here can be [Renaissance](item_a460f234-6434-4d47-99f9-d4a0b15cd591), [Distortion](item_5557e2f2-02df-4eac-8128-0c23b71183b1), or [Battle Medic](item_ccd0edff-4d57-4ac2-83a7-bab6ff0ffb2f). All synergize well with Crep. [Serenity](item_c6e1c072-ff50-467e-b59f-9506baea10c1) can also be situationally good if you need help staying alive.

### ITEMS

The example is another budget build that prioritizes HPS. [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48) is the best lower-cost choice for prioritizing healing at this point, but there are other items I prefer in different circumstances. I added notes under the "optional items" section.

round_upgrades.notes:
I recommend [Battle Medic] if you have good aim. [Crepuscular Circle]  +  [Battle Medic] enables you to go full battle Mercy during Valk. My aim sucks but even I still get some good use out of it. If your team seems hopeless, give this a shot.

(Also, Battle Medic increases Crepuscular Circles healing. Super powerful combo!)
[Renaissance] +  [Crepuscular Circle] basically turns res into a nuke. It's a riskier playstyle, but sooo satisfying when it works. I recommend this is you enjoy playing around res.
This is the #1 item I recommend if you are having trouble surviving, Nebula Conduit helps a LOT. It gives you a tiny bit of extra WP, too!
Necessary if you chose the "Renaissance" or "First Responder" Powers.
If you chose the "Battle Medic" Power, consider choosing this; it is a decent increase in DPS, at the cost of healing (-10 HPS).
If you are pistoling, recommended against Orisa, Reinhardt, or Dva.
If you can afford it, this gives a little bit more HPS than Booster Jets, like +5 HPS.
This item can keep you alive through Junkrat's Riptire & Cassidy's High Noon, & can help you get off risky ress's. It's also nice just for the HP & +10% WP.
This item is so good for evading people focusing you, especially Genji & Kiriko. I really, really recommend this against them.

If you need to play a little safer, try this. The extra range lets you position so much more safely, & it's great for reaching Genji & Freya. Combine this with [Blessed Boosters] if you want to be untouchable.

Substitute with [Blessed Boosters] if the enemy team is chasing you around; [Overdrive Core] against Junkrats focusing you with tire;  [Caduceus Ex] if you need to healbot, or for pocketing Genjis & Tanks
Recommended if you're more of a bluebeam Mercy. It combo's well with [Crepuscular Circle] because the lifesteal will be constantly active during Valk.
This power is great just for getting res off more reliably. Combining this with the [Overdrive Core] item can help you get off some very aggressive ress's.

(UPDATE) This power is currently bugged: Any amount of damage instantly deletes **all** 50 Overhealth. I.e., taking 1 damage gets rid of all of it. Until this is fixed, I would not recommend this power against beam characters like Zarya or Moira, who can instantly deplete the Overhealth from just 1 tick of their weapons.

notes:
### STATS

HP: +75 (+50 Armor, +25 Health) | 
Healing: 125-145 HPS | DMG Boost: 35% (+5%)

----

### ITEMS

More healing, [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) is just a big statstick. I love it! Check optional item notes for alternative item choices.

Necessary if you chose the "Renaissance" or "First Responder" Powers.
Recommended if "Battle Medic" Power was chosen instead of "Glass Extra Full".
If you are pistoling, recommended against Orisa, Reinhardt, or Dva.

Consider building this you are having an especially hard time staying alive against burst-damage characters specifically. (Ie, Cassidy, Torpedo Juno, Rocket Soldier, etc.)

NOT recommended as a counter against sustained damage, or shotgun characters.

If you need to play a little safer, try this. The extra range lets you position so much more safely, & it's great for reaching Genji & Freya. Combine this with [Blessed Boosters] if you want to be untouchable.

notes:
### STATS

HP: +75 (+50 Armor, +25 Health) | 
Healing: 130-150 HPS | DMG Boost: 35% (+5%)

----

### POWERS

 [Distortion](item_5557e2f2-02df-4eac-8128-0c23b71183b1)  is great with  [Threads of Fate](item_cb61612b-9d83-49a9-989d-013bf084fbcb),  [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb), & [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca). Just another power that helps keep your team alive.

Alternative Power choices here can be [Renaissance](item_a460f234-6434-4d47-99f9-d4a0b15cd591),  [Protective Beam](item_3f1ef995-8ecc-45fb-8b57-26fdccc21feb), or [Battle Medic](item_ccd0edff-4d57-4ac2-83a7-bab6ff0ffb2f). [Serenity](item_c6e1c072-ff50-467e-b59f-9506baea10c1) can also be situationally good if you need help staying alive.

### ITEMS

At this point, [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) is the only item you can take to get more HPS when replacing your blues. [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e)  actually gives you a miniscule amnt of extra HPS compared to other 15% threshold items, but it's fine to replace with other items.

Check optional item notes for alternative item choices. I recommend *always* keeping [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124), [Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b), and [Booster Jets](item_a291de85-b6d9-43cf-b5da-f3184a156f48), everything else is expendable. This amount of healing is pretty overkill, to be honest, so I do recommend considering the other items.
